title: Learned Hand
summary: Billings Learned Hand (/ˈlɜːrnɪd/ LURN-id; January 27, 1872 – August 18, 1961) was an American jurist, lawyer, and judicial philosopher. He served as a federal trial judge on the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York and later as an appellate judge on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.
